originalText.text: Dr Goldberg and her team are truly the best - we have taken both of our dogs there for 8 and 7 years respectively both at the old space on Lex and the new space on 94th - the entire team from front desk to vets are truly caring, kind and dedicated.   We trust their team inherently with Monty and Francine.

text.text: Dr Goldberg and her team are truly the best - we have taken both of our dogs there for 8 and 7 years respectively both at the old space on Lex and the new space on 94th - the entire team from front desk to vets are truly caring, kind and dedicated.   We trust their team inherently with Monty and Francine.

originalText.text: Honestly one of the greatest around. Dr. Goldberg and her entire staff are knowledgeable, compassionate, skilled and kind. They handled my delicate little lemon of a cat with such love. My boy was in such pain, had to have 10 teeth extracted, and now he’s finally back to himself now! Worth every penny.

text.text: Honestly one of the greatest around. Dr. Goldberg and her entire staff are knowledgeable, compassionate, skilled and kind. They handled my delicate little lemon of a cat with such love. My boy was in such pain, had to have 10 teeth extracted, and now he’s finally back to himself now! Worth every penny.

originalText.text: I have been with the UES vet for almost 2 years now and every time I went there the staff poorly treated me. I am about 1 week asking questions in regards the international travel with my pet and the answer from Jackie (the person who supposedly should answer the questions) was that she was very busy and didn’t have time to go over the phone or get any appt. I called them and again, poor customer service. People were upset and they transferred the call to Jackie when I told them that I was going to write a NICE review. So finally when I got Jackie over the phone she said that she was very stressed with the situation and It was a “courtesy” from them to “explain” things about international travel. Long story short: I will change my veterinarian place and look for a better customer service since this place is VERY EXPENSIVE and I wouldn’t recommend it at all. Good luck if you want go there with your pet.

originalText.text: Perfect first time appointment experience! I always get nervous going to the vet because my mastiff is not particularly dog friendly, but they took us into a room right away and made him comfortable. The front desk staff are very courteous and polite. The place is extremely spacious and super clean, all of the vet techs were so kind and gentle with my 100+ lb Dogo Argentino and Dr. Kessler was great - very thorough, attentive and answered all of our questions. We did not feel rushed out of the exam or pressured into unnecessary tests like with so many other practices. I HIGHLY recommend them!

originalText.text: They'll steal your money. I've been taking my dog to Upper East Vet for six years.  After Covid they have come back in absolute shambles. My dog hurt his leg and I wanted to get it X-rayed.  I called in and they insisted I make an appointment, because he had too fast to be under for the x-ray.  Next morning, at the appointment Dr. Talia Goldberg told me she couldn't attended to my pet because three emergencies just walked in. After a condescending speech, she finally took my pet back for the imaging.  I paid $750.00 for ex-ray results and they didn't send them in for analysis. Be prepared to pay $5.15 for every needle they use, they call it a disposal fee, Five dollars, each.  And now the final straw; they are holding my 16 year old dog's seizure medicine until I go in for another appointment for blood work after only 9 months .
